newsitem.title: USA: Introgen to offer less shares in IPO.
newsitem.headline: Introgen to offer less shares in IPO.

text.p: Introgen Therapeutics Inc has cut the number of shares to 2.7 million to be offered in its proposed initial public offering, according to a regulatory filing.

Introgen initially proposed an offering of 3.2 million shares. The shares are estimated to price in a range of $10 to $12 each and the offering, expected in early November, is being lead managed by PaineWebber.
Introgen develops gene therapy products to treat cancer by direct intoduction of the gene inside the the body ("in vivo").
